speakers.name: Dr. Charles C. Phiri
speakers.title: Executive Director – SME AI/ML Innovation, JPMorgan Chase
speakers.topic: How AI Democratizes Resilient, Risk-Aware Innovation and Scalable Digital Transformation
speakers.biography: Executive Director – SME AI/ML Innovation, JPMorganChase. Dr Charles C. Phiri is a distinguished architect dedicated to advancing well-behaved, auditable AI/ML and data-intensive systems. With over 25 years of experience engineering transformative solutions across multiple disciplines and industries, Dr Phiri is an Executive Director with JPMorgan Chase, designated as SME AI/ML Innovation in the Global Technology Enterprise Architecture team. His work contributes to redefining enterprise-wide AI/ML reference architectures and consumption patterns, forming the baseline for distributed AI/ML and agentic system risk. Throughout his career, Dr Phiri has achieved high-impact successes, ranging from designing scalable R&D solutions in financial services, semiconductors, telecommunications, space and defense, digital storage infrastructure, and medical devices, to spearheading innovative projects that merge deep technical rigor with practical application. Notably, the included exoskeleton-based solution to assist post-stroke patients in regaining mobility and contributed to cutting-edge advances in robotics, commercial satellite systems, microwave and RF systems, A-GPS systems, real-time embedded technologies, MEMS, and ultra–low-power designs, progressing from R&D to the commercialization of multi–billion devices. A respected thought leader and active contributor in his field, Dr Phiri researches advanced AI/ML systems with a clear focus on delivering practical, real-world solutions in constrained environments. His other contributions include areas such as neuromorphic computing, deep learning, spiking neural networks, robotics, context-free grammars, formal verification, and the systems engineering of robust, characteristically auditable distributed AI systems in real-world environments. His academic research interests include developing real-time collision avoidance for industrial robotic arms (ICIRA 2021) and fuzzy rule-based outlier detection (ISA Transactions, 2021); dynamical system specification and stabilization (ICIRA 2017); accelerating robot learning through context-aware middleware (ICIRA 2016); adaptive, intelligent self-calibrating systems (2011); and scaffolded life-long robot learning from human skills (2019), all of which underscore his dedication to bridging theoretical innovation with tangible, real-world applications. Dr Phiri is a Senior IEEE Member, a Chartered IT Professional with the British Computer Society, and designated Gartner Peer Community Ambassador. He earned his PhD in Humanoid Robotics from the University of Portsmouth, reading humanoid robot learning from human action skills (motion planning, scaffolded life-long robot learning). He holds an MSc in Internet Systems from the University of Liverpool. Beyond his corporate credentials, Dr Phiri is passionate about leveraging technology (including AI/ML for remote sensing and satellite imaging systems) to address critical gaps in food systems across Sub-Saharan Africa through regenerative precision agriculture and logistics ventures. His lifelong commitment to self-calibration is exemplified by his accomplishment as a 4th Degree Black Belt in Tae Kwon-Do, which is built on the tenets of courtesy, integrity, perseverance, self-control, and an indomitable spirit.

speakers.name: Counsel Khumbo Bonzoe Soko
speakers.title: Managing Consultant & Litigation Lead, Soko & Co. | Former Chairperson, Malawi Law Society
speakers.topic: AI for Justice: Strengthening Legal Systems and Access to Justice through Technology
speakers.biography: Khumbo is a diligent, passionate, astute and highly organized trial lawyer with over 16 years post qualification experience. His practice has spanned several areas of the law including criminal law, commercial law, employment law, constitutional and administrative law, electoral law, insurance law, public procurement law and taxation law. Khumbo regularly appears in the Supreme Court of Appeal, the High Court of Malawi, Arbitral tribunals and in other specialized administrative tribunals such as the Review Committee of the Public Procurement and Disposal of Assets Authority (PPDA), the Financial Services Appeals Committee and the Revenue Appeals Tribunal. His strength lies in his sharp ability to diagnose issues that call for resolution, his formulation of an effective resolution strategy, surgical organization of his case and in effective presentation. Khumbo thrives whether he is acting alone or as a part of a team and has vast experience in organizing and leading multi-member litigation teams. One of the most high-profile case in which he has appeared is the Presidential Elections case that led to the nullification of the 2019 presidential elections. Khumbo has also worked as a consultant in assignments requiring deep analytical skills. These assignments have included consulting with constitutional Parliamentary Committees carrying out investigation work, policy and legal analysis and legislative lobbying. Khumbo has also supported corporate clients in their restructuring and re-organization with a view to managing the resultant legal risks and has represented and advised multinationals in high value transactions. Khumbo is an effective presenter and has presented papers at national and international seminars, workshops and conferences. Khumbo holds a Bachelor of Laws (Honours) Degree which he obtained from the University of Malawi's Law School as well as a Master of Laws Degree in International Economic Law (with distinction) obtained from the University of Warwick in Coventry England in 2014. He is a respected voice in the legal profession having previously served as the Chairman of the Malawi Law Society (2017 – 2018.) He has also previously served as a member of the Special Law Commission reviewing the Malawi Citizenship Act. He has previously served as a member of the Board of Directors of the National Economic Empowerment Fund (NEEF) and Petroleum Importers Limited. At Soko & Co, a firm which he co founded in September 2014, Khumbo works as the Managing Consultant as well as the Litigation Lead.

speakers.name: Samuel Foster Chiwanda
speakers.title: Founder and CEO | Click Mobile

Click Mobile employees' people from across Africa. Samuel Studied in University of Eastern Africa, Baraton in Kenya where he did two degrees, Business Information Technology (BIT) and a BSc in Networks and Communication Systems. Samuel has spent over 15 years in the Telecommunications industry gives Samuel a wealth of expertise and experience in telecommunication from a business development, operations to a technical perspective. Suffice to say the overall business journey has also led to expertise in navigating the complexities of international markets and a deep understanding of the entrepreneurial landscape across Africa and United Arab Emirates. Samuel has led Click Mobile into winning serval awards. Click Mobile was voted Africa Provider of the year in 2023 at the Meucci Antonio Awards.  Click Mobile also won the Outstanding performance Telco team Honors Award at the Meucci Awards in 2024.  This year 2025 Click Mobile won the TICON company of the year award in Ghana. Samuel has won several industry Awards.  In 2022 Africa CXO Award of the Year.  He also came number 7 out of 100 in the Rocco awards in Malaga, Spain.  Samuel has also won the high distinction award as the leading telco male professional 2024 at the Antonio Meucci Awards.  This year Samuel won the TICON ICTC professional of the year in Ghana BIT and BSC in Networks and Communication Systems | 2022 Africa CXO Award of the Year |Leading Telco Male Professional 2024 at the Antonio Meucci Award | TICON ICTC professional of the year TICON ICTC professional of the year in Ghana.

speakers.name: Tjiyapo Velempini
speakers.title: CTO MTNSAT Africa | Chairman of E-Hub Energy | Treasurer and Executive Member Computer Society of Zimbabwe  |  Founding Partner of Phoenix Advisory
speakers.topic: AI Powered Economic Empowerment and Financial Inclusion for Africa
speakers.biography: Tjiyapo Velempini is a seasoned Information Technology and Infrastructure Advisor with extensive experience in public administration and utilities currently serving the Computer Society of Zimbabwe (CSZ) as a Council Member and an Executive Member where he is the Treasurer. Professionally he is the Chief Technology Officer for MTNSAT Africa a Global Telecommunications Infrastructure Provider focusing on Low Earth Orbit (LEO) Satellite (Starlink, Kuipers, OneWeb, etc), Mobile 4G/5G and Optical Fibre Deployments in an integrated ecosystem. Tjiyapo is the Chairman of E-Hub Energy a Company focussed on providing Sustainable Energy to the African Continent leveraging on available resources to create a versatile Energy Mix.  both being companies focused on Technological Solutions and Systems. He is a Founding Partner for Phoenix Advisory (PHXA) which is a Global Advisory player on Emerging Technologies and their practical application for the advancement of Africa and her people. His professional background includes roles such as Director of ICT & Infrastructure Development, Director Internal Audit at the Zimbabwe Revenue Authority (ZIMRA) and Engineer/Technical Auditor at the Zimbabwe Electricity Supply Authority (ZESA). He contributes to discussions on Information Communication Technology Development, Data Protection, Compliance and the Democratisation of Energy & Data Networks to bridge the Digital Divide. He participates in relevant and aligned industry events where he shares his Industrial, Financial and Public Administration Sector Expertise. He is an advocate for use of Modern and Emerging Technology in producing Clean Energy, Managing Environmental Issues, Managing Small and Efficient Governments, Vibrant Financial Sectors and the African Economy. Tjiyapo speaks to the use of nuclear energy as the critical & sustainable power source of the Future in Africa and Globally.

speakers.name: Dr. Serah Beza Mbewe
speakers.title: Director of ICT at Levy Mwanawasa Medical University (LMMU)
speakers.topic: TRANSFORMING EDUCATION WITH AI: PERSONALIZED LEARNING AND SMART CLASSROOM
speakers.biography: Dr. Serah Beza Mbewe, DBA (IT), MSc, BSc Computer Science, is an accomplished ICT expert with over 18 years of experience in academic, technical, and strategic ICT roles. She currently serves as the Director of ICT at Levy Mwanawasa Medical University (LMMU), where she leads the implementation of ICT strategies across multiple campuses, oversees infrastructure, cybersecurity, and staff development, and supports digital transformation in teaching and learning. She also lectures part-time at ZCAS University in Financial Modelling and Research Methods. Dr. Mbewe's previous roles include ICT Manager at ZCAS University, where she directed ICT governance and lectured in IT; Assistant Dean for Open, Distance and eLearning (ODeL), managing online education delivery and content development; and Senior ICT Consultant, where she led both internal and external digital consultancy initiatives. She began her academic career as a Lecturer at Copperbelt University, teaching programming and computer science courses. Her research includes topics in green computing, lean management, and youth unemployment, and she has presented papers at national and international conferences. Dr. Mbewe serves as Vice President of the ICT Association of Zambia (ICTAZ), and contributes to several academic, professional, and faith-based committees. She is a mentor in the Girls in ICT initiative and actively supports ICT-driven innovation and capacity building in higher education.
